r.s: PHP_CodeSniffer tokenises PHP code and detects violations of a defined set of coding standards.
r.d: PHP_CodeSniffer is a PHP5 script that tokenises and "sniffs" PHP code to detect violations of a defined set of coding standards. It is an essential development tool that ensures that your code remains clean and consistent. It can even help prevent some common semantic errors made by developers.
r.n: - Added a config system for setting config data across phpcs runs - You can now change the default coding standard from PEAR to something else -- Run: phpcs --config-set default_standard [standard] - Added new Zend coding standard to check code against the Zend Framework standards -- The complete standard is not yet implemented -- Specify --standard=Zend to use -- Thanks to Johann-Peter Hartmann for the contribution of some sniffs -- Thanks to Holger Kral for the Code Analyzer sniff
